GCodes

Available GCode calls on the machine

Functions
G0
G0;

Set rapid mode

G1
G1;

Set linear mode

G2
G2;

Set clockwise controlled arc mode

G3
G3;

Set anti-clockwise controlled arc mode

G4
G4 P100; G4 X10;

Dwell for the specified time.

Notes

If a P argument is specified, sleep for the defined number of milliseconds:

G4 P100; //sleep for 100ms

If an X argument is specified, sleep for the defined number of seconds:

G4 X10; //sleep for 10s
G17
G17;

XY Plane Circle Interpolation

G18
G18;

ZX Plane Circle Interpolation

G19
G19;

YZ Plane Circle Interpolation

G20
G20;

Inch mode

G21
G21;

Metric mode

G28
G28 A() B() C() X() Y() Z();

Move to machine reference position

Example
G28A20B30C40X50Y60Z70
G53

Move in absolute machine coordinates

Example
G53A20B30C40X50Y60Z70
G54
G54

Apply work offset at index 0

G54.​1
G54.1 P(
_WorkOffsetIndex_
)

Apply specified work offset.

G55
G55

Apply work offset at index 1

G56
G56

Apply work offset at index 2

G57
G57

Apply work offset at index 3

G58
G58

Apply work offset at index 4

G59
G59

Apply work offset at index 5

G68

Coordinate rotation

Example
G55 R20 X30 Y40
G90
G90

Absolute mode

G91

Incremental mode

G110
G110 I(
_OffsetIndex_
) II(_OffsetType_) A() B() C() U() V() W() X() Y() Z() AA() BB() CC() UU() VV() WW() XX() YY() ZZ()

Set offset

Example

Set the X, Y, and Z parts of the global offset at index 0 to 10

G110 I0 II0 X10 Y10 Z10
See Also

  • OffsetManager.SetOffset

G111
G111 I(
_OffsetIndex_
) II(_OffsetType_) A() B() C() U() V() W() X() Y() Z() AA() BB() CC() UU() VV() WW() XX() YY() ZZ()

Increment offset

Example

Increment the X, Y, and Z parts of the global offset at index 0 by 10

G111 I0 II0 X10 Y10 Z10
See Also

  • OffsetManager.IncrementOffset

G128
G128 A() B() C() U() V() W() X() Y() Z() AA() BB() CC() UU() VV() WW() XX() YY() ZZ()

Set User Reference Position

G129
G129 A() B() C() U() V() W() X() Y() Z() AA() BB() CC() UU() VV() WW() XX() YY() ZZ()

Move relative to User Reference Position

G154
G154 A() C() F() T() W()

Apply offsets

See Also

  • OffsetManager.ApplyOffset

Notes: This function applies the offset(s) passed in depending on the argument used:

* A()

all offsets

* C()

Component offsets

* F()

Feature offsets

* T()

Tool Offsets

* W()

Work Offsets

Example: Apply the work offset at index 5 and the tool offset at index 10

G154 W(5) T(10)
